Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: AandT_10
Reviews.Content: Our 1st time staying in Venice and we think we made a great choice to stay. Clean comfortable room average breakfast but reasonably priced. The best thing is the position so central. We found the staff very friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast, Centrally Located, right off the San Zaccharia”
Reviews.Author: Lyle W
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st Hotel we stayed in Italy, I would highly recommend this Hotel. The staff was very nice, everything was done by email. There was a slight language barrier but as long as you are friendly you can understand and figure out what everything means. The Breakfast was amazing especially after a long and tiring traveling day. We were allowed to use their free internet to check in with Family to let them know we arrived. Large room clean and comfortable with good ensuite facilities. Staff very accommodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A very good alternative.”
Reviews.Author: Bimbimbap_and_Donnie
Reviews.Content: We originally booked with Hotel Wildner, when we arrived we were told they were still under renovation and were directed to a 'sister' hotel, Hotel Fontana. Nice hotel, very pleasant stay but wifi is only available on the first floor, although they do provide free internet at a computer by the lobby, wifi is paid for and only available on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: quinkie18
Reviews.Content: So friendly and welcoming! A warm haven to return to after a day out in the cold January weather. Hotel well situated near S. Marco and waterbus stop. Largish room clean and comfortable with good ensuite facilities. Staff very accommodating and helpful. Our stay at the Fontana was altogether a pleasant and heartwarming experience. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “What a great little family hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevinj86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a short break, the hotel s very close to San Marco Sq and is a great find! I would have no problem recommending the hotel, very friendly staff, very clean. We would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebh572
Reviews.Content: very convenient to the wonderful city of Venice. Our room was very comfortable, wonderful crisp sheets, roomy and bright bathroom. Everyone at the front desk and Grandmother who was always there were pleasant, helpful and spoke English (except Italian grandmother). We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely few days in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sdcman
Reviews.Content: we spent a few days in venice at the beginning of october staying at the fontana this hotel is certainly in a brilliant location a few mins walk from st marks square and the san zaccaria vapretto stop and rialto bridge if you choose to walk as we do and see real venice only 10-15 minutes to walk and easily found. Hotel very nice and clean, very helpful stuff who speak very good english and nothing was no trouble was a little small but very good value for money and would certainly stay there again.Plenty of eateries very close including one opposite so need to wander far if you didnt need to. One drawback seemed to be a gathering point for school children to congregate from about 7am and lots of children do make quite a cackle! Venice as everybody knows can be very expensive but there are very nice and reasonable places to eat though drink seems expensive wherever you go.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find”
Reviews.Author: krinkly
Reviews.Content: Our group of six were pleased with our rooms and the location of the hotel. The breakfast is generous and tasty in an attractive room. The young guy at the main desk was friendly and informed.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: inneed0fah0liday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fontana for three nights in September 2011, and thought it was great! Our room was surprisingly large, and had a view of the San Zaccharia, the cleanliness was of a good standard. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, we felt very welcome. There is a nice, and often busy, little bar next to the hotel, I would recommend making this your last stop for the night. The breakfast was basic, but was adequate and plentiful. The location was as good as you will find, only a five minute walk from St Mark's Square. Finally, do not underestimate the benefit of being able to get off the water bus at San Marco, San Zaccharia, and being able to walk to the hotel without crossing any bridges, try not to be too smug when you see sweaty tourists dragging their suitcases over all the bridges!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice locale”
Reviews.Author: mongoosre
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Fontana and loved it. The rooms and hotel were very clean and service was amazing. We stayed in a room with a terrace with a nice view of a small church and square. The breakfast was really nice, the hardboiled eggs were a nice touch. The owner was extremely friendly and helpful, he made reservations for us at a nice restaurant and treated us great. I've found that great service like this place tends to make or break how you feel about a hotel experience. Lastly, Its only maybe a 3 minute walk from St. Marks square, situated perfectly because its just outside enough so that you can regain your sanity from the busy day of sight seeing. We will stay here again when we return to venice!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cestrian7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fontana was wonderful. We could not fault it. The family and their staff have it just right - a real home from home. Would advise you ask for room 11 with a lovely balcony overlooking San Zaccharia church!. A traditional Venetian hotel in an excelent location literally 5 minutes from Saint Mark's Square and the vaparetto at San Zaccharia Jolanda. The Steiner family deserve the excellent reputation they have.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jdunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this family run small hotel for 3 nights and could not have asked for a better location. There is a small elevator, decent size rooms, very clean accommodations and a good European breakfast included. It is close to St. Mark's, the Danieli Hotel and the waterfront. Hairdryers are not included in the bathrooms which woud have been convenient and there is one community computer with internet available for guests. There are only 16 rooms on 4 floors with some rooms available across the street in an annnex I would recommend this hotel unless you are looking for luxury. The location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, yet quiet & with small terrace! Would return!”
Reviews.Author: newtraveler1948
Reviews.Content: The proud family owners were friendly & accomodating, and we enjoyed stepping out the door of Fontana and being in the midst of Venice's charm and activitiy! Our room unfortunately wasn't as large/attractive as others shown in the pictures, but it was quiet & clean, with a small terrace overlooking San Zaccaria Church. (the bells chiming - lovely!) Their breakfast was large by Italian standards- soft boiled eggs, toast, butter, ham, cheeses, pastries, cereal, yogurt, orange juice, espresso & coffee, tea, milk & more! ALL Venice is touristy...Fontana's location offers the best of everything we thought, and would stay there again, (in an updated room with a shower enclosure!) Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: paddyh117
Reviews.Content: this hotel is all about location - if you're not fussy, it's not modern, very basic breakfast, and very basic decor etc, then it's perfect - it was cheap, and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sam2066
Reviews.Content: Had a good experience staying 2 nights in this Hotel located in San Marcos, just 5 minute walk to Saint Marks square and basilica. easy access from fairy and all other water transportation, close to shops and many restaurants, peaceful and quite area, the rooms are a bit small (from the room we got) and of course all decorated in a venetian style. overall clean beds, floor, walls and bathroom. very friendly staff and helpful.. Do recommend for the price, service and best of all its location!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family run hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: rachs40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my 40th birthday treat and I was happy with my stay. Not only because of the wonderful sites of the city of Venice but the safe atmostphere of the Fontana Hotel who are very proud that their hotel has been run by only the family for 50 years. This gives you the reassurance that whatever little problem you may have they will do their utmost to remedy it and you really can feel safe to leave your valuables in the room. I really recommend this place for that fact alone! The area is surrounded by some lovely bars and restaurants but there is no noise problem - I loved opening the windows in the morning to hear the sound of the atmostpheric church bells nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff. Clean rooms of varying quality. Very touristy location”
Reviews.Author: jpin86
Reviews.Content: My first room was incredibly spacious, with a beautiful, roomy bathroom. My second room was much smaller, with nauseating yellow bedspreads. The staff were very friendly and helpful. However, the location of this hotel is in a very touristy location, which I will be sure to avoid in the future. Also though the hotel is nice, it feels very old and frumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: trower1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of October to the beginning of November. Lovely family hotel, the staff are knowledgible and friendly. We had a room which looked out over the garden and the San Zaccaria church, and what a beautiful church it is well worth a visit. The bed was big and comfortable, did ask for a couple of more pillows which was no problem at all. The only thing i personally didn't like was that it was blankets rather than a duvet on the bed, as they kept slipping off the bed during the night. The rooms have a wardrobe and a televison ( you only get BBC World news or CNN if you don't speak Italian) Breakfast was coffee, juice, milk etc, cereals, bread rolls, pastries, yoghurt, tinned fruit, butter and a small selection of cheese. More than adequate to set you up for a morning. There are a couple of bars nearby which are quite good value (so long as you are prepared to stand and drink at the counter) the restaurants would be good value, if there wasn't a seating fee, a 12 1/2% cover charge etc.... very expensive for nearly everything including self service cafe's. A great city neverless, and a wonderful experience, even managed to gate crash Mass at St Mark's on the Sunday which was something else, even if you're not Catholic!

Reviews.Title: “In declline”
Reviews.Author: Poophiles
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times in recent years. The quality has diminished each visit. Breakfast is now barely worth getting up for and the coffee (instant) ia surely the worst in Italy. Qualitty of rooms varies greatly. Staff remains courteous and friendly and location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel, the location and staff were wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeandWine74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel without knowing much about Venice and absolutely loved it. We did not spend much time in the room, but the location is perfect and the staff could not be more helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this location and hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem - wonderful location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sheila321
Reviews.Content: This family owned and run gem is a block away from St. Marks. You can find Grandma sitting in the front room most mornings! The people are warm, welcoming and helpful; the hotel is clean and bright and great value for money. There are plenty of pretty good restaurants/cafes right there and it's an easy walk to the water buses. We found this by accident as our original booking had been canceled due to 1800hotels.com going bankrupt! I was traveling with my mum, who is in her 80s, so were in a bit of a panic! The girls at our original hotel (Traviatore) were so kind and helpful. They called Hotel Fontana for us and, despite it being high season, they were just so nice and managed to put us up in the "Palace" - an old building just across from the main hotel. We had two rooms, which were clean and comfortable. I plan on returning to Venice one day and will definitely stay here. Great value, great location, great service - you can't beat it. Thank you Hotel Fontana, for making our stay in Venice so wonderful and for being so kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Fontana - Very Friendly Hoteliers”
Reviews.Author: claydemler
Reviews.Content: Casa Fontana was a splendid place to stay. I was there from August 17, 2009 through August 18, 2009. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I felt very welcomed; more so than any other hotel I stayed at during my entire two week trip. My room overlooked a S.Provolo Trattoria and was on the third floor. The hotel was quiet, even when I had the windows open. The room and bathroom were clean and traditionally furnished (my preference). The bathroom was the smallest of my entire trip, but was perfectly functional and clean. I would definitely stay there again on a casual trip. The breakfast was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect staff.”
Reviews.Author: HMK101
Reviews.Content: We got a top floor room with a perfect view over the square with a church. The staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast could be bigger and with some different pieces of famous italian ham. The location is perfect with restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sarahmichelle223
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fontana was a great hotel in a PERFECT location. We were only in Venice for one night until we took the train to Lake Como, so we had little time to see the city. For this reason, Hotel Fontana was perfect - only a short walk to everything. We walked to Saint Mark's square, the bridge of sighs, the Rialto bridge, etc. It was all so close - Saint Mark's square was perhaps the equivalent of one city block! We got the hotel room with the balcony and it was beautiful - looked right onto a church. Breakfast was as you would expect - cappuccino, rolls, yogurt, etc. The front desk was helpful and gave us some great dinner recommendations and even mailed our postcards for us! Great value for the cost - I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay to see Venice.”
Reviews.Author: FerretfaceEngland
Reviews.Content: The two brothers and all the staff were great, very helpful. Our room was ideal for us and the adjoining room for our teenage daughter gave her privacy too. We were stuck for an extra 4 nights because of the Volcano...shame it could not have been longer! If you are looking for swimming pools..room service..and entertainment, go stay somewhere else. If you want somewhere to stay that is comfortable, friendly, in a great location and is great value then this is the place for you. We'd definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Been there four times now.”
Reviews.Author: LightmasterScotland
Reviews.Content: Warm and welcoming family run hotel incredibly near San Marco. The guys who do reception on alternate days are both full of very helpful advice. eat where they recommend and you won't go wrong. Grandad's cognacs are lavishly poured!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location !”
Reviews.Author: shiretraveller
Reviews.Content: Never thought we would be able to stay in Venice itself however, we found this great 2 Star B&B hotel about 150 meters from San Marco Square and the Grand Canal at a very reasonable price. Stayed in a quad room with our two teenage daughters for 3 nights bit of a tight fit but the location, friendliness and advice from the staff more than compensated. We loved the bells of nearby San Zacharia Church would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “a little Gem”
Reviews.Author: asurbanipal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fontana, round the corner from St Zaccharia, three minutes walk from St Marks square and a wonderful little family hotel. No luxury, but clean and functional, warm and friendly, helpful and with a quaint charm - a little Gem. Your friend and helper Diego is a mine of information - just ask him - and take his advice! The coffee machine in the breakfast room is pure Rock `n Roll and produces an excellent cuppa! The bar prices are more than acceptable for Venice, and father, although he speaks only Italian, is a helpful and jolly barkeeper. All round: very friendly, very helpful, room service and cleanliness are excellent and the PRICE IS RIGHT!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: OZevents
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in September at Hotel Fontana. The location is great, close to the water taxis, shops, and gorgeous cafes. The hotel is quiet, clean and the staff are amazing, so friendly, and helpful in arranging a variety of tours for us during our stay. The breakfast is included and they have a selection of cheeses, yogurts, breads and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “central location and price out weigh any flaws”
Reviews.Author: shelliestar
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in Hotel Fontana in July, and can't fault it too much. The rooms are basic but spacious, and look exactly like the photos. The location was the winner for us as its just minutes walk everywhere, and right beside the main vaporetto stop to travel the islands. Was a perfect base for us, especially for dropping back into during the day and has about 5 resturaunts right outside the door. The room itself was fine. The bed wasnt great, and our air conditioner gave a bit of a smell but it was cleaned every morning, had a nice view, and great shutters to keep out the sun. The breakfast is standard, juice, cereal and some bread and cheese. It was nothing to get too excited about but the staff were friendly and helpful and if you go to venice to see the city then this hotel will be perfect, as its so close to everything. Also we booked through a third party hotel booking site and got our room for half the price, â‚¬65 a night!!!!! Which by Venice prices is amazingly cheap. So if youre not looking for plush rooms, and want somewhere cheap and ideally located then look no further. We had an amazing time exploring venice and being able to quickly drop back to the hotel to leave bags or take a nap. Also there is a lift (think it was installed last year) and the free internet and helpful staff in the reception make it easy to plan your days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff, traditional Venezian style room”
Reviews.Author: yokogreen
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay at Hotel Fontana. Before our trip we read reviews saying that there was no elevator in this hotel, so we were prepared to walk stairs with our luggage, but they had an elevator(we stayed on the third floor). We also got a free upgrade of our room without us asking. The room had a terrace. Very good location. This hotel is on the Rick Steves guide book too.

Reviews.Title: “Really a pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: gdrvasc
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my wife and 10 yr old son. Given the choices available in such a tourist mecca with high priced lodging, this is a real find with good value, very little in the way of compromises. Our room for 3 was plenty big, good A/C, elevator relatively new. Bathroom by European standards was average size, small shower, but otherwise fine. Good water pressure. Comfortable and quiet location, but just 7 minute walk to the square. The hotel is in a quiet locale, minutes from the vaporetto stop at San Zackariah. Staff very helpful and good suggestions for what to do. One complaint was no wi-fi, but there is a public computer at the front desk, limited hours of use 8am-10pm. Would have loved to have had the wi-fi option. Remember---Italian elec outlets are not the standard European ones and you will need an adapter with three small round prongs, not the usual two. Breakfast was perfectly fine--I don't understand the complaints--yogurt, cereal, typical breads, jams, coffee, cheese. If you want more than this, go out for bkfst, but good luck...the Italian bkfst is just not an American bkfst.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in an incredible location.”
Reviews.Author: LaloPeru
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better...a very short walk from the main St. Mark vaporetto stop. VERY important in a town without taxis. The hotel is more than OK for the price. The single room was tiny but impeccably clean. There was an elevator, and had no problems with the air conditioning. Also, the staff couldn't have been friendlier. Only faults: My tiny single room had also a cot, that wasn't removed. That didn't leave much room to walk. The other was the coffee in breakfast. It was VILE!!! Sugest you take your instant. The rest of it was good and abundant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel - close to the action, but away from the noise”
Reviews.Author: Frankies_Family
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fontana one each end of a Med Cruise in August. We took the express bus from the Airport to P. Roma, then a vaparetto to San Zaccaria stop. With bags on wheels it was a quick walk to the Hotel, which was easy to find. This was an easy trip and much less expensive than other transportation options. We arrived fairly early, dropped our bags downstairs and headed out to enjoy the city. The rooms were clean, spacious for Italy and very quiet. Yes, you have to climb stairs. Luckily, we weren't in and out of the hotel too much during the days. The desk staff was very helpful and greeted us like old friends when we returned for the second half of our stay. The light breakfast was perfectly fine. The rolls were delicious! Don't come down late, though. We came in just before the breakfast hours ended and someone shooed us away and began turning the lights out just after we sat down. Be aware that a full bath may mean a half size tub with a hand sprayer and no shower curtain. Having our own private terrace and a beautiful view of San Zaccaria more than made up for small inconviences like tub size or stair climbing. St. Marks is a short walk away as is a vaparetto stop. We had no trouble finding our way back to the Hotel from where ever we were touring. It's not the Ritz, but for the price and location, we enjoyed our stay and would happily return there.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel- Breakfast was great!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyT
Reviews.Content: The Fontana Hotel by far exceeded our expectations for the price we paid and its location. Sure the room wasn't huge, but we got two ensuite doubles for the price of a triple. It was the perfect setup for us and our 8 yr old son. When my husband started snoring, I even had a spare bed to crawl into! Even though there were a lot of stairs, I wouldn't trade the view of San Zaccaria's church and Venice rooftops for a lift ever! Our son's room was tiny, but becasue it was situated in a corner, each side with a window, there was plenty of cross ventilation. Had there not been, we were offered a fan. Our room had an air conditioner that actually kept all of the rooms pretty pleasant. We actually ended up just opening the windows at night and plugging in the little electronic anti bug scented devices that were provided. They seemed to work as we never saw or experienced any bugs in our romm, though they were about outside. Although the bathroom too took up a corner, it had been recently remodeled with modern amenities, and it's L shape actually provided for more movable space not less. In fact, it was it's situation directly under the gabled roof that gave this room its charm. The whole hotel staff ran the place very efficiently from baking fresh rolls on site for breakfast to keeping the rooms spotless and fully supplied daily. Diego's fluent English, local knowledge, and good cheer especially made the reception warm. He made us feel personally welcomed upon our arrival, and treated us as if we were long awaited old friends. He really seemed to want to hear about our adventures each day too. You could tell he really loved his city and wished others also to do so. The owner's recommendations for dinner were spot on, and it would seem he and his family have lived there -perhaps even somewhere on site -for a long time. We were especially pleased with the breakfasts as I had not expected much after reading the reviews. I don't know what one would expect a "continenal breakfast buffet" to contain, but it certainly met our needs. I'd be as fat as a pig if I were able to eat fresh baked Italian rolls daily as we did there! My son was warned not to expect much, so he was particulary pleased to find Coco Puffs on offer as well as several other "boring" cereals. Although we did not partake of the full bar, we did enjoy having access to the inexpensive beers and sodas available on site. How nice to be able to grab an ice cold beer on the way back to the room at the end of a hot day. Diego also kindly let us store our bags at the hotel after we had checked out, enabling us to do some final sightseeing on our final half day. Lastly, the location could not have been quieter or more convenient. I was worried that with restaurants on the Calle down below it might be noisy, but they literally rolled up the awnings and took the whole place away by 10pm! Calle San Zaccaria is so deserted after the day trippers leave that the locals bring out their toddlers to ride their "Big Wheels". After hearing horror stories of lost tourists wandering around hauling suitcases, I also couldn't believe how easy it was to find the hotel. Once I realized it sits on the backside of the Calle San Zaccaria, all we had to do was follow the signs for San Zaccaria Church about 2 LEVEL blocks from the Vaporetto/Alilaguna stop. Easy to pick out on any map too for the same reason, but I never did end up needing one. In the early morning it seemed to be the route of choice for local business people commuting in from the outer islands and mainland. They made for some interesting people watching. I would think coming in to the St. Z stop from the mainland would be much quicker than trying to fight the crowds by commuting down the Grand Canal. As has been noted, the only drawback is that there are 4 ( 5 for Americans) floors and no elevator, They tell me they are putting one in, but I almost wonder if that will spoil some of the "old world " charm of the place. The TVs in the room could also use a bit of upgrading as they have to be "tuned in." But who comes to venice to watch TV? For those who must, there is a very nice flatscreen in the bar area. Internet would be a nice, modern addition. Good value for the money, though (great for Venice) and the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Central Venice”
Reviews.Author: Timems
Reviews.Content: Awesome location, brilliant staff. The furniture is very "classic" and rooms have NOT been recently updated but the location and staff make up for the slightly tired decor. Well worth a visit but dont expect smart rooms, you can expect a great location and prices were very reasonable especially for summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great location for sights, airport and travel outside of venice”
Reviews.Author: mrpearce1802
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you are looking for somewhere reasonably priced in a great location. The hotel is clean and tidy, the rooms are cleaned daily and are air conditioned. So close to st marks square, the lagoon and all the transport hubs. The staff were so friendly giving us advice on where to go, and also timetable information. Breakfast is very basic but is of a good standard for the price. The main point is the hotel is well worth its price.
